projectDesc.p: ParlaMint is a project that aims to (1) create a multilingual set of comparable corpora of parliamentary proceedings uniformly encoded according to the Parla-CLARIN recommendations and covering the COVID-19 pandemic from November 2019 as well as the earlier period from 2015 to serve as a reference corpus; (2) process the corpora linguistically to add Universal Dependencies syntactic structures and Named Entity annotation; (3) make the corpora available through the CLARIN.SI repository, concordancers and Parlameter; and (4) build use cases in Political Sciences and Digital Humanities based on the corpus data.

category.catDesc: Legislative period: term of the parliament between general elections.

Legislative session: the period of time in which a legislature is convened for purpose of lawmaking, usually being one of two or more smaller divisions of the entire time between two elections. A session is a meeting or series of connected meetings devoted to a single order of business, program, agenda, or announced purpose.
Meeting: Each meeting may be a separate session or part of a group of meetings constituting a session. The session/meeting may take one or more days.
Legislative period: term of the parliament between general elections.

Legislative session: the period of time in which a legislature is convened for purpose of lawmaking, usually being one of two or more smaller divisions of the entire time between two elections. A session is a meeting or series of connected meetings devoted to a single order of business, program, agenda, or announced purpose.
Meeting: Each meeting may be a separate session or part of a group of meetings constituting a session. The session/meeting may take one or more days.
Legislative period: term of the parliament between general elections.

Legislative session: the period of time in which a legislature is convened for purpose of lawmaking, usually being one of two or more smaller divisions of the entire time between two elections. A session is a meeting or series of connected meetings devoted to a single order of business, program, agenda, or announced purpose.
Meeting: Each meeting may be a separate session or part of a group of meetings constituting a session. The session/meeting may take one or more days.
Legislative period: term of the parliament between general elections.

Session: A parliamentary year, which always begins on the first Tuesday in October at 12.00 o’clock noon and ends on the same date at the same time the following year. However, parliamentary work at Christiansborg is organised in such a way that it primarily takes place from October to June.
Meeting: Each meeting may be a separate session or part of a group of meetings constituting a session. The session/meeting may take one or more days.

Sitting: a parliamentary meeting. The course of the year is planned in accordance with a number of working processes and recurring events. Sittings for the coming parliamentary year are planned in advance, and the plan specifies the days on which there will be sittings and the weeks during which there will be no sittings in the Chamber. Parliamentary committees usually have one or two regular weekly meetings, but not all of them hold meetings every week, especially not during the summer. During a parliamentary year, there are about 100 sitting days.
Legislative period: term of the parliament between general elections.

Periodo de sesiones: periodo en el que se celebran las sesiones parlamentarias con propósitos legislativos. Generalmente, durante la legislatura hay uno o dos periodos de sesiones. Una sesión, por su parte, se convocan para abordar un orden del día en uno o varios encuentros parlamentarios.

Legislative session: the period of time in which a legislature is convened for purpose of lawmaking, usually being one of two or more smaller divisions of the entire time between two elections. A session is a meeting or series of connected meetings devoted to a single order of business, program, agenda, or announced purpose.
Sesión: reunión de un órgano parlamentario (en uno o varios encuentros) vinculado a un orden del día.
Meeting: each meeting may be a separate session or part of a group of meetings constituting a session. The session/meeting may take one or more days.
Legislative period: term of the parliament between general elections.
Legislative session: a period of time in which a legislature is convened, typically one year.
Meeting: Each meeting will be a constitute part of a parliamentary session.
Legislative period: term of the parliament between general elections.

Legislative session: the period of time in which a legislature is convened for purpose of lawmaking, usually being one of two or more smaller divisions of the entire time between two elections. A session is a meeting or series of connected meetings devoted to a single order of business, program, agenda, or announced purpose.
Meeting: Each meeting may be a separate session or part of a group of meetings constituting a session. The session/meeting may take one or more days.
Legislative period: term of the parliament between general elections.

Legislative session: the period of time in which a legislature is convened for purpose of lawmaking, usually being one of two or more smaller divisions of the entire time between two elections. A session is a meeting or series of connected meetings devoted to a single order of business, program, agenda, or announced purpose.
Meeting: Each meeting may be a separate session or part of a group of meetings constituting a session. The session/meeting may take one or more days.
Kjörtímabil: tímabil milli tveggja reglulegra kosninga
Legislative period: term of the parliament between general elections.

Þing: sá tími þar sem þing kemur saman til lagasetningar og er yfirleitt annað tveggja eða fleiri tímabila milli kosninga. Þing samanstendur af þingfundi eða röð þingfunda, sem eru eyrnamerktir ákveðinni dagskrá, fyrirfram ákveðnum tilgangi eða ætlaðir til afgreiðslu tiltekinna mála.

Legislative session: the period of time in which a legislature is convened for purpose of lawmaking, usually being one of two or more smaller divisions of the entire time between two elections. A session is a meeting or series of connected meetings devoted to a single order of business, program, agenda, or announced purpose.
Þingfundur: Hver þingfundur getur jafnt verið stakur eða hluti af röð þingfunda á þingi og getur tekið einn dag eða fleiri.
Meeting: Each meeting may be a separate session or part of a group of meetings constituting a session. The session/meeting may take one or more days.
Legislatura: mandato del parlamento fra elezioni politiche generali.
Legislative period: term of the parliament between general elections.

Legislative session: the period of time in which a legislature is convened for purpose of lawmaking, usually being one of two or more smaller divisions of the entire time between two elections. A session is a meeting or series of connected meetings devoted to a single order of business, program, agenda, or announced purpose.
Meeting: Each meeting may be a separate session or part of a group of meetings constituting a session. The session/meeting may take one or more days.
Parlamento kadencija: laikotarpis tarp nacionalinių parlamento rinkimų.
Legislative period: term of the parliament between general elections.

Parlamento sesija: laikotarpis, kurio metu parlamentas posėdžiauja įstatymų leidybos tikslais. Paprastai, tokių smulkesnių laikotarpių būna du ar daugiau tarp dviejų nacionalinių parlamento rinkimų. Sesija yra posėdžiai arba susietų posėdžių grupė, skirta svarstyti tam tikrą programą, darbotvarkę, darbotvarkės punktą ar kitokį iš anksto paskelbtą dalyką.

Legislative session: the period of time in which a legislature is convened for purpose of lawmaking, usually being one of two or more smaller divisions of the entire time between two elections. A session is a meeting or series of connected meetings devoted to a single order of business, program, agenda, or announced purpose.
Posėdis: kiekvienas posėdis gali būti atskira sesija arba posėdžių grupės sudedamoji dalis. Sesija ar posėdis gali trukti vieną ar daugiau dienų.
Meeting: each meeting may be a separate session or part of a group of meetings constituting a session. The session/meeting may take one or more days.
Legislative period: term of the parliament between general elections.

Legislative session: the period of time in which a legislature is convened for purpose of lawmaking, usually being one of two or more smaller divisions of the entire time between two elections. A session is a meeting or series of connected meetings devoted to a single order of business, program, agenda, or announced purpose.
Meeting: Each meeting may be a separate session or part of a group of meetings constituting a session. The session/meeting may take one or more days.

Parliamentary committees usually have one or two regular weekly meetings, but not all of them hold meetings every week, especially not during the summer. During a parliamentary year, there are about 100 sitting days.

application.label: INT Tagger, lemmatizer and Tokenizer
application.desc: INT Tagger, lemmatizer and Tokenizer for modern Dutch, based on old-school machine learning (SVM). It provides the legacy PoS tags (encoded in w/@ana) and the lemmata for Dutch. Not publicly available.

application.label: Udify
application.desc: UDify is a single model that parses Universal Dependencies (UPOS, UFeats, Lemmas, Deps) jointly, accepting any of 75 supported languages as input. Available from https://github.com/Hyperparticle/udify

application.label: Flair NLP NER tagging for French and Dutch
application.desc: A powerful NLP library. Flair allows you to apply our state-of-the-art natural language processing (NLP) models to your text, such as named entity recognition (NER), part-of-speech tagging (PoS), sense disambiguation and classification, with support for a rapidly growing number of languages. Available from https://github.com/flairNLP/flair

application.label: Trankit: A Light-Weight Transformer-based Python Toolkit for Multilingual Natural Language Processing
application.desc: Trankit is a light-weight Transformer-based Python Toolkit for multilingual Natural Language Processing (NLP). It provides a trainable pipeline for fundamental NLP tasks over 100 languages, and 90 downloadable pretrained pipelines for 56 languages. Available from https://github.com/nlp-uoregon/trankit

application.label: ReLDI tokeniser
application.desc: Tokenisation and sentence segmentation with ReLDI tokeniser, available from https://github.com/clarinsi/reldi-tokeniser.

application.label: CLASSLA-StanfordNLP
application.desc: MSD tagging and lemmatisation with CLASSLA-StanfordNLP trained for Slovene, available from https://github.com/clarinsi/classla-stanfordnlp.

application.label: NER system for South Slavic languages
application.desc: Named entity recognition done with the Janes NER program, trained for Slovene and available at https://github.com/clarinsi/janes-ner.

application.label: UDPipe 2 (czech-pdt-ud-2.6-200830 model)
application.desc: POS tagging, lemmatization and dependency parsing done with UDPipe 2 http://ufal.mff.cuni.cz/udpipe/2with czech-pdt-ud-2.6-200830 model

application.label: NameTag 2 (czech-cnec2.0-200831 model)
application.desc: Name entity recognition done with NameTag 2 http://ufal.mff.cuni.cz/nametag/2with czech-cnec2.0-200831 model http://hdl.handle.net/11234/1-3443. Posprocessing: nested named entities has been merged to four categories (PER, LOC, ORG, MISC).

application.label: CSTlemma lemmatizer for Danish
application.desc: Lemmatiser that uses affix rules (affix: prefix, infix, suffix, circumfix). Rules are obtained by supervised learning. Bart Jongejan and Hercules Dalianis (2009). Available from GitHub.

application.label: Text Tonsorium
application.desc: Web application that automatically composes and enacts workflows consisting of NLP and format transforming tools. clarin.dk. Bart Jongejan (2020). Available from GitHub.

application.label: UDPipe tools for Danish
application.desc: MSD tagging and dependency parsing with UDPipe http://ufal.mff.cuni.cz/udpipe trained for Danish, available fromhttps://github.com/ITUnlp/dapipe.

application.label: CST Named Entity Recogniser
application.desc: CST's named entity recogniser classifies names as person, organization, location or miscellaneous. Available as part ofhttps://github.com/kuhumcst/texton-linguistic-resources.

application.label: Stanza
application.desc: Tokenisation, POS tagging, NER and dependency parsed using Stanza, a Python NLP language analysis package https://stanfordnlp.github.io/stanza/. UD parsing was trained on the Spanish AnCora Treebank https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Spanish-AnCora.

application.label: Stanza
application.desc: Stanza – A Python NLP Package for Many Human Languages, pretrained neural network model for French, available from https://github.com/stanfordnlp/stanza.

application.label: UD French GSD
application.desc: Universal Dependency, French treebank, GSD packagehttps://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_French-GSD.

application.label: WikiNER for French
application.desc: WikiNER, NER model for Frenchhttps://figshare.com/articles/dataset/Learning_multilingual_named_entity_recognition_from_Wikipedia/5462500.

application.label: Stanford CoreNLP
application.desc: Tokenisation, POS tagging, NER and dependency parsed using Stanford CoreNLP https://stanfordnlp.github.io/CoreNLP/.

application.label: ReLDI tokeniser
application.desc: Tokenisation and sentence segmentation with ReLDI tokeniser, available from https://github.com/clarinsi/reldi-tokeniser.

application.label: CLASSLA-StanfordNLP
application.desc: MSD tagging and lemmatisation with CLASSLA-StanfordNLP trained for Slovene, available from https://github.com/clarinsi/classla-stanfordnlp.

application.label: NER system for South Slavic languages
application.desc: Named entity recognition done with the Janes NER program, trained for Slovene and available at https://github.com/clarinsi/janes-ner.

application.label: UDPipe
application.desc: Tokenisation, sentence segmentation, UD morphological features assignment and dependency parsing with UDPipe, available from https://lindat.mff.cuni.cz/services/udpipe/.

application.label: Magyarlanc linguistic toolikt
application.desc: MSD tagging and lemmatisation with magyarlanc linguistic toolkit, available from https://rgai.inf.u-szeged.hu/magyarlanc.

application.label: NER system for Hungarian
application.desc: Named entity recognition with NER recognizer tool, trained for Hungarian and available at https://rgai.inf.u-szeged.hu/node/109.

application.label: Tokenizer
application.desc: Tokenisation and sentence segmentation with Tokeniser from Miðeind, available from https://github.com/mideind/Tokenizer.

application.label: ABLTagger (PoS)
application.desc: Part-of-speech tagging with ABLTagger (PoS), avaiable from http://hdl.handle.net/20.500.12537/98.

application.label: Nefnir
application.desc: Lemmatisation with Nefnir avaiable at https://github.com/jonfd/nefnir

application.label: NER
application.desc: Named entity recognition done with the NER program, trained for Icelandic and available at https://github.com/bennigeir/NER.

application.label: Ufal.udpipe
application.desc: MSD tagging done with the ufal.udpipe avaiable at https://pypi.org/project/ufal.udpipe/.

application.label: Stanza
application.desc: Stanza: a jointly trained neural tagger, lemmatizer and dependency parser. Pretrained model based on the italian-isdt-ud-2.5 treebank

application.label: T2K
application.desc: T2K: contains a named entity recognition module for Italian.

application.label: CoNLL-U 2 TEI XML
application.desc: CoNLL-U 2 TEI XML: converter from CoNLL-U format to (ParlaClarin/ParlaMint) Tei XML Format

application.label: Spacy
application.desc: Parsing, tokenization and sentence segmentation also MSD tagging and lemmatisation with Spacy, available from https://spacy.io/ .

application.label: NLP-PIPE: Latvian NLP Tool Pipeline
application.desc: Latvian natural language processing pipleine, available from http://nlp.ailab.lv/.

application.label: INT Tagger, lemmatizer and Tokenizer
application.desc: INT Tagger, lemmatizer and Tokenizer for modern Dutch, based on old-school machine learning (SVM). It provides the legacy PoS tags (encoded in w/@ana) and the lemmata for Dutch. Not publicly available.

application.label: Udify
application.desc: UDify is a single model that parses Universal Dependencies (UPOS, UFeats, Lemmas, Deps) jointly, accepting any of 75 supported languages as input. Available from https://github.com/Hyperparticle/udify

application.label: Flair NLP NER tagging for French and Dutch
application.desc: A powerful NLP library. Flair allows you to apply our state-of-the-art natural language processing (NLP) models to your text, such as named entity recognition (NER), part-of-speech tagging (PoS), sense disambiguation and classification, with support for a rapidly growing number of languages. Available from https://github.com/flairNLP/flair

application.label: Trankit: A Light-Weight Transformer-based Python Toolkit for Multilingual Natural Language Processing
application.desc: Trankit is a light-weight Transformer-based Python Toolkit for multilingual Natural Language Processing (NLP). It provides a trainable pipeline for fundamental NLP tasks over 100 languages, and 90 downloadable pretrained pipelines for 56 languages. Available from https://github.com/nlp-uoregon/trankit

application.label: Morfeusz
application.desc: Morfeusz: analizator i generator fleksyjny.
Morfeusz: inflectional analyser and generator.

application.label: Concraft
application.desc: Concraft: tagger morfosyntaktyczny dla języka polskiego oparty na warunkowych polach losowych.
Concraft: morphosyntactic tagger for the Polish language based on conditional random fields.

application.label: Liner
application.desc: Liner: narzędzie do rozpoznawania nazw, w tym nazw własnych i wyrażeń czasowych.
Liner: a framework for sequence labeling, including: named entities, temporal expressions.

application.label: COMBO
application.desc: Liner: tagger neuronowy, lematyzator i parser zależności zaimplementowany w Pythonie 3 przy użyciu biblioteki Keras.
Liner: jointly trained neural tagger, lemmatizer and dependency parser implemented in python 3 using Keras framework.

application.label: ReLDI tokeniser
application.desc: Tokenisation and sentence segmentation with ReLDI tokeniser, available from https://github.com/clarinsi/reldi-tokeniser.

application.label: CLASSLA-StanfordNLP
application.desc: MSD tagging and lemmatisation with CLASSLA-StanfordNLP trained for Slovene, available from https://github.com/clarinsi/classla-stanfordnlp.

application.label: NER system for South Slavic languages
application.desc: Named entity recognition done with the Janes NER program, trained for Slovene and available at https://github.com/clarinsi/janes-ner.

application.label: TRmoroph morphological analyzer
application.desc: Tokenisation, sentence segmentation, lemmatization, POS tagging, morphological features with TRmorph. Available from https://github.com/coltekin/trmorph.

application.label: UDPipe 2 (turkish-imst-ud-2.6-200830 model)
application.desc: Dependency parsing done with UDPipe 2 http://ufal.mff.cuni.cz/udpipe/2with czech-pdt-ud-2.6-200830 model
An LSTM tagger published on GitHub https://github.com/snnclsr/ner.
